did.unittitle: Law School (University of Michigan) Photograph and Artwork Collection 1870-1994 1900-1950
did.abstract: Portraits, photographs, and artwork previously displayed in the University of Michigan Law School, featuring prominent alumni, faculty, notable figures in the legal profession, and images of the Law School grounds. Also, records concerning art owned by the Law School, including surveys, inventories, reports, and scattered information on specific portraits.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The material was received from the Law School in 2008 (Donor no. 343).

accruals.p: No further additions to the collection are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open without restriction.

userestrict.p: Copyright status of individual items varies.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Law School (University of Michigan) Photograph and Artwork Collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: For many years, the University of Michigan Law School solicited portraits of its most prominent graduates to decorate its classrooms, study areas, and public spaces with law-related themes. Through these efforts many new portraits were added to the large body of paintings and photographic portraits already displayed in the Law School. Although the Law School made several partial inventories, no comprehensive effort was made to inventory all the Law School artwork until the university received support from the Michigan Commission on Art in Public Places in 1988, at which point a detailed description of all the art was made.

In 1994, the Law School put together an updated catalog of its art, and in 1997-98, additional inventories were made for risk management and insurance purposes, but they lacked the level of detail of the 1988 inventory. In 1993-94, several administrators proposed that much of the art be removed from the Law School. The works were re-evaluated based on their condition and subject matter, and eventually most were removed from classrooms and study areas.

The framed photographs, documents, and artwork that were removed from the Law School were stored in various locations throughout the Law School. In 2008, the removed artwork was transferred to the Bentley Historical Library. For storage and preservation purposes, most images were removed from their frames with the exception of oil paintings.

scopecontent.p: The University of Michigan Law School Photograph and Artwork Collection contains portraits of faculty, alumni, and notable legal figures as well as several inventories of the art, and documentation requesting portraits, risk management measures, and decisions to remove much of the artwork.
The records are arranged into four series: Documentation, Individual Photographs and Portraits, Other Artwork and Documents, and Oil Paintings.

The series Documentation includes files on the Art and Memorials Committee plans and reports, 1976-1978; information on specific portraits (which is not comprehensive); various inventories of the artwork and risk management documents; correspondence concerning requests for portraits, 1975-1977; and decisions to remove the portraits from display.

did.unittitle: Art and Memorials Committee Plan and Report 1976-1978
Art Inventories by University of Michigan Law School
Commission on Art in Public Places Surveys 1989

scopecontent.p: The Photographs series is comprised of individual photos (both informal photos and formal portraits) of Law School alumni, faculty and legal notables not associate with the university, as well as some composite and group photos of students faculty Many of these items are oversized. The photographs of alumni and faculty may be original photographs or copies; the copied photographs could be enlargements of newspaper clippings or photographs taken of hand drawn portraits. The photographs are arranged alphabetically by the subject's last name. All individual photos are listed in single alphabetical listing, but the oversized items are stored in boxes 2-4.
All the items in the Photographs series were received from the Law School and were removed from their original frames for storage and preservation purposes.

did.unittitle: Supreme Court of the United States 1886
LLM Class of 1890 with additional professor
Snapshots of Professors in Class circa 1940
Notable Figures (not affiliated with the University of Michigan)

scopecontent.p: Other Artwork and Documents series is divided into: Law School Grounds, and Printed Materials. Within the subseries Law School Grounds are photographs and drawings of the Law School quadrangle and its surrounding buildings. Within the subseries Printed Materials, is located a small collection of diplomas issued by the University of Michigan Law School as well as a variety of other printed items, including resolutions in praise of a colleague's work, and a guide to the stained glass windows in the Legal Research Library. Much of the materials in this subseries are arranged chronologically.

odd.p: (This provides a box/folder breakdown of the oversized photos. All individual items are listed above.)

scopecontent.p: The Oil Paintings are not physically part of this collection, but are listed here for convenience. The paintings are large oil portraits done of Law School faculty, alumni, and other notable figures. Most of the portraits are in their original frames, but some of the portraits were removed from their frames for preservation purposes. The framed portraits and the unframed portraits are separately located, with the framed portraits hanging in the Bentley Library connecting bridge in the closed stacks.
The 1994 "Law School Art Catalog" in the Documentation series contains images of most of the Oil Paintings.

odd.p: (paintings noted as "unframed" are stored in a separate location)
